website_summaries.verdict: Gives you a good value for a set of five grow bags. Tough fabric that's breathable.
pros: Available in sizes between 3 and 15 gallons, which means you have quite a few options for the types of plants you place in the grow bags
Handles at the top of the bag give you the opportunity to move it easily
Fabric is lightweight and breathes well, which helps keep the plants' roots aerated
cons: Bag sizes will run smaller than advertised

customer_reviews.title: Thick, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Slight order issue with the wrong size pots sent, but the seller immediately fixed my issue. Really great experience! The pots themselves are thick, sturdy, and very well made. The five gallon size (what I was originally sent) would do great with single plants about the size of peppers, tomatoes, or even bush beans varieties, or with smaller root veggies like radishes and beets. The seven gallon size looks perfect for squash plants (my plan for them) and even sturdy enough to grow vining veggies out of (I'll experiment with cucamelons and tomato cages with the seven-gallon pots). Will definitely be ordering more, and from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: GlassHalfFull

customer_reviews.title: We are farmers now
customer_reviews.text: These are a great alternative to traditional planters for people who don't have a yard. I got 7 gallons for better bush tomatoes. They are sturdy and much nicer looking than buckets.
customer_reviews.author: Jacobim

customer_reviews.title: Grow bag strong
customer_reviews.text: First time I have heard of let alone tried grow bags. I like them a lot, if you don't want to spend a fortune on pots then this is a good alternative. The only thing I will say is that you will have to water your plants more often then pots as these are extremely porous. If anyone figures out a way to still drown a plant using these bags should go in the Guinness Book of Records :)
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't quite sure what to expect since these were one of the least expensive batch of grow bags I found and was pleasantly surprised. We use them for our outdoor tomato plants. These are exactly what I was looking for in fabric grow bags. Stitching is high quality and strong, the handles feel very durably attached. We will be ordering more next season, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great material, very strong
customer_reviews.text: Great material, very strong. I put 3 year old blueberry plants in them which after putting all the soil was very heavy but the handles were able to withstand the weight I would guess 25lbs or more. Looks really great in my garden.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love the product
customer_reviews.text: I use it to plant vegetables and I love it because of the good drainage, I don't have to worry about it. It is sturdy and I have been using it through 2 growing seasons now.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for patio gardening
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect size for patio gardening. I have a tomato plant in one and 3 peppers in another. The peppers do not need the depth, so I put some empty water bottles in the bottom before adding soil
customer_reviews.author: Debbie R.

customer_reviews.title: Finally got tomatoes
customer_reviews.text: I am a new gardener and wanted to grow tomatoes. I tried last year and they died. I tried in my raised bed this year and they died. I bought these so i could plant them and give them more space to branch out. They’re lol doing amazing! So glad i bought these.
customer_reviews.author: Kiyanna Williams

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Great for patios and small yards. I got the seven gallon bags for my small veggie garden. I have already planted peas, potatoes, and carrots. I do not have to worry about root rot due to this being a rabid bag. I do plan to by more.
customer_reviews.author: RealRosenna

customer_reviews.title: Great smart pots
customer_reviews.text: These are great for tomatoes. Durable, easy to move and store, and the plants love them. They drain faster and dry out faster than other pots, but sometimes that’s a good thing!
customer_reviews.author: Plant Grower

customer_reviews.title: Handy reusable portable planter with handles.
customer_reviews.text: These smaller bags are great for plants that don’t get really large. They drain well and there is plenty of room for the roots. If needed you can put a small post in it to support your plant or near fence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it ...if you like soft containers
customer_reviews.text: 5 star because it works as advertised. I realized I prefer to use hard container. These don't work as well if not completely filled. The black color attracts the sun and causes water to evaporate quickly. Worked well for growing jalepenos.
customer_reviews.author: Urskie

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy & great air flow
customer_reviews.text: These fabric bags are very sturdy when completely full with moistened soil and a plant in them, nothing has torn and the bag has excellent air flow for the roots of your plants. Good price for 5 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Believer?
customer_reviews.text: What can I say they are well made and do their job am a believer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Fits great in 7 gallon container.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my growing by placing grow bags in my plastic planter
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son who has a back deck, this will allow him to grow some veggies. Seemed very sturdy. Better than trying to move large heavy pots
customer_reviews.author: OzarkRider

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy material make-up
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fabric pots. A great buy compared to grow bags from other brands that I've purchased in the past & have deteriorated after only one outdoor season
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Size and Sturdiness appear very good.
customer_reviews.text: Using for first time as container garden. Bags are sturdy feeling, and size I expected. Should do well for vegetables I plan on planting......Excited to see if as successful as hoped.
customer_reviews.author: becca

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a durable planter for my vegetables that I can easily shift while moving . This is so perfect and the handles are strong . I can fill it fully with growing sand and still can move around . No rips so far . Thanks for this product at this price !
customer_reviews.author: Monika visaka Raghuraman

customer_reviews.title: 7 stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these fabric pots, 7 gal is perfect for my summer garden. They are big enough for plenty of growth and small enough to be maneuverable
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Russell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: The handles on these are very sturdy. I had to move my plant around a lot and this was perfect for that. Now that my grow is over, I have the soil out of it, and it’s still in perfect condition. Once I clean it I’ll be good to grow again!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: These things are the best for my indoor herb grow room. Plenty big so roots have lots of room. And the handles make it easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D.

customer_reviews.title: These are a great find!
customer_reviews.text: These grow bags ended up working great for my vege plants on my deck. I can move them around easily. The materiable is durable, the handles are strong...they were put out in May and its September and I see no signs of ware. Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Lantz

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Got a couple different brands and types happy with these inexpensive and great
customer_reviews.author: Amaz00n

customer_reviews.title: Great for Container Gardening...if you watch the water intake
customer_reviews.text: This product was the solution for past garden pests eating vegetables sown in the ground. But it was super tricky to keep the crop hydrated properly. Bags didn't retain moisture like I had hoped. Mushrooms started sprouting from the sides of the bags. I still recommend as long as you keep a close eye on your plants.
customer_reviews.author: Christie B.

customer_reviews.title: Must try
customer_reviews.text: Best I have ever used so easy and sturdy my plants look great and drains nicely
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Wenger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: gift for my daughter in law and she loves them and looks forward to planting in them this Spring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was hoping for!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made cloth pots. I was wonderfully surprised how sturdy they are on their own. Much better than any pots I’ve purchased so far. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: over all great product. Perfect size and they seem to be very durable.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Just starting to use them now that the weather has warmed up to plant

customer_reviews.title: Growing Bags for my fall plants
customer_reviews.text: I'm about to plant in these bags for my fall planting. I already have some with plants in them and I like them so far. We'll see what happens.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Purchase. Fully Functional
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Handles strong. 7 gallon planting bags. Would purchase again

customer_reviews.title: The best flower pots I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these. They have exceeded my expectations. Super sturdy and my tomatoes are already sprucing up.

customer_reviews.title: Love these planter bags
customer_reviews.text: I love the ability to move them from the greenhouse to the garden.

customer_reviews.text: these worked great for me. 7 gallon bags hold 40 pounds of top soil-1 40lb bag

customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice growing bag for my tomato plant. Not thick enough tho. Water leaks out sometimes.

customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy, easy to use, and work great for my veggies!

customer_reviews.text: Feel like the plants did better with these than plastic containers where the roots normally get root rounded and problems draining water. Haven’t had the problem with theses yet.

customer_reviews.text: They did the job for my summer garden, I love them, so easy to move and handle.

customer_reviews.text: Nice bags. Time will tell on how many seasons I'll get out of them.

customer_reviews.text: I will never use a plastic pot again these are the best

customer_reviews.text: I like these pots and seem to be quiet durable.

customer_reviews.title: That  the  price was  good.
customer_reviews.text: What I liked about the bags.they were sturdy. Using bags for plants.

customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good and holds up well to the weather. Will see how many taters ive got at the end of the season.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and perfect for the plants
customer_reviews.text: The handles are strong and the fabric prevents over watering. I will buy more in the future

customer_reviews.text: These are great. Perfect size for what I put in um. Very strong reusable, you can't go wrong.

customer_reviews.title: Great product

customer_reviews.title: Strong, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: They stand up well, don't discolor as other lighter grow bags have done and my plants are thriving. Love these.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Product came in a timely fashion. Looks sturdy seems to be a real nice product.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than described
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than 7 gallons. Durable but way smaller than described. Still a bit smaller than my 5 gallon containers. Disappointing.

customer_reviews.title: Great for herbs!
customer_reviews.text: Love these portable grow bags. They are perfect for my herbs and I can move them around easily.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous product! My tomatoes and peppers are doing exceptionally well.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bags
customer_reviews.text: Love these! They've held up really well in the time we have been using them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of moving them in the garden. Plants are thriving!
customer_reviews.author: Michaeline

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love this planters! Easy to move the entire plant/pot when it needs to get more sun etc.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: GO WITH A SMART POT OR EVEN PLASTIC. NOT FOR INDOOR. TOO MUCH SIDE WATER LEAKAGE.
customer_reviews.text: THESE DO NOT RETAIN AS MUCH WATER AS SMART POTS DO! I WENT FROM WATERING ONCE A WEEK, TO EVERY 2-3 DAYS.
customer_reviews.author: Cruzader

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold moisture for more than a day.
customer_reviews.text: Well after having them for a few weeks I’m not happy. They do not hold any moisture at all for the plants. I’m having to water every single day. I expected to have to water every other day or so but not definitely every day. I wont Be using these next year at all. Going to go back to the old Pots .
customer_reviews.author: nothappycamper42

customer_reviews.title: They are GREAT for people with broken vertebras!
customer_reviews.text: Love them. I have a healed but broken back so these are great. Have 3 types of tomatoes in 3, pumpkins in 1, 3 green peppers in one, 2 cucumbers in 1, 2 squash in 1, just planted lettuce in 1, onions in 1 and getting ready to order more. With them sitting on the ground it's easier to plant and harvest. Let me know I can send pictures. AND if they go on sell I want 15 more. LIVE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pots for Container Planting
customer_reviews.text: I've been gardening for 15 years. This season I decided to try fabric grow pots. It's now my favorite way to grow! In addition to the obvious benefit of being mobile and reusable, these pots are perfect for healthy root growth and maintaining even moisture. This is the first year my crops have been disease/pest free. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: You can see mold growing on them
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that I can move these around. But, the do grow mold. I bought new ones from Grassroots made in USA 🇺🇸 great customer service. I like that I can call them and a real person picks up that is very caring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uses more water than other containers, but stronger roots.
customer_reviews.text: I've got my tomatoes and some Jalapenos in them. At the price, one or two years service out of these would be reasonable for backyard gardeners. Just don't sit directly on ground. Water leeches through bag and grass loves growing around them. Tends to dry out quicker then pots, but roots are stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff if no place to plant on ground
customer_reviews.text: Great bags; was wider than thought and therefore shorter. That said it is really good bag, and it feels light even filled with soil. Durability: wait and see
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.text: I love these planting bags! So far they are performing marvelously...plants are taking off and don't dry out as quickly as in pots. Even filled with dirt, they are easy to move around. This is a wonderful product and worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dameron

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived next day as a Prime member. These are so easy and convenient for people with limited outdoor space. Added bonus of handles make it easy to move. Plants are doing well and I am pleased with such a reasonably priced product.
customer_reviews.author: harmony71

customer_reviews.title: Love this growing planter, veggies are as happy as I am.
customer_reviews.text: My swiss chard is loving it's growing environment in these cloth pots. I will buy more next spring in larger sizes for my zucchini.
customer_reviews.author: HappyLemonHead

customer_reviews.title: seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: appear to be well sewn and sturdy. I have not yet filled them with dirt and plants but feel comfortable doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Grrrbear

customer_reviews.title: Grat Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought these when they were 5 for $10. Real sturdy and strong and wash up real nice in the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt B.

customer_reviews.title: Well made, 2 gallons larger than a typical pot and EASY to move. Now if someone could just come up with lighter soil.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, light weight and easy to pick up with the handles to move chasing the sun around my shady yard. This 5-pack cost less than one 5 gallon plastic pot. You don't have to worry about over watering as the description states but as with any container growing you need to water it practically every day.
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: They worked awesome for my garden this year. Great drainage and hold the dirt very well. Plants grow very well in them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanna Moss

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, movable, quality, and good size
customer_reviews.text: I love my new garden bags! I purchased the 7 gallon bags for different types of lettuces to grow on my patio. I also use 10 gallon bags but they require more dirt and I grow different veggies in them. I really like how durable the bags themselves are. They're cloth like, are very movable and seem to be of really good quality. I would definitely recommend these bags!
customer_reviews.author: Sara M

customer_reviews.title: Seems well put together
customer_reviews.text: Item okay, lighter weight material than what I have got previously from a different vendor, otherwise seems well put together but will it hold up. Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: lta

customer_reviews.title: Durable and breathable
customer_reviews.text: Maneuverability? Yeah, Amazon asked me that. I wouldn’t drive one in city traffic, but they work great for growing tomato plants.
customer_reviews.author: Roadhunter

customer_reviews.title: These are the bomb!
customer_reviews.text: Love these so much!! Much better than traditional pots for the plants. Going back to buy larger ones. This is fine for tomato size plants.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Quality is on point
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the material used on these pots, the 7 gallon size is very large actual 7 gallon size.

customer_reviews.title: Seems small...
customer_reviews.text: Really seems smaller, but honestly I am not gonna measure. They are big enough to use so they are fine.

customer_reviews.title: Good pots!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good pots, very sturdy and you can still fold the rim over! My plants love them

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with these pots. The black looks really nice and they are sturdy!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good, strong material and put together solidly, I am very happy with these planters and would buy them again!

customer_reviews.title: Ethel Murray, Great bags
customer_reviews.text: Well made, great value. I've had no problems using theses bags, gardening has become my passion and theses bags have made it easy for me to enjoy it. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ethel Murray

customer_reviews.title: My cat can hide in the 7 gallon size.
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the 3 and 7 gallon packs and the seem to be very sturdy. I've seen people gardening with bags like this on YouTube so I glad I saw them on amazon. Even if you don't plant anything they would still be good to carry your library books or groceries. My cat can hide in the 7 gallon size.
customer_reviews.author: julia

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I ever expected.....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two 5 packs of the 7 gallon grow bags, and they "may be" 5 gallons each. I guess they will have to do, but I needed something that is bigger than a 5 gallon pail... As pictured here. Not as happy as I wanted to be.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica F.

product_meta.title: HONEST OUTFITTERS 5-Pack 7 Gallon Smart Grow Bags for Potato/Plant Container/Aeration Fabric Pots with Handles (Black)
feature_bullets: High quality nonwoven fabric,better than plastic container,protect envirnment
Decreased risk of transplant shock with bag handles
Keeps plant warmer in winter and cooler in the summer,Allow the root breathe, Prevents roots circling and air-prunes plant's root structure
Promise: The quality and service is our first aim.we can refund if you donot like our product
